techmeme.title: Snappr, a visual content platform and a marketplace for professional photographers, raised a $28M Series B led by Foundry and expands to Europe (Kerry Flynn/Axios)
A survey of US parents: 90% say their kids aged 12 or younger watch TV, 68% say their kids use a tablet, and 61% use a smartphone; 8% of kids use an AI chatbot (Pew Research Center)
German officials say they will vote against the EU's "Chat Control" proposals, signaling the bloc will not have enough support ahead of an October 14 vote (Suzanne Smalley/The Record)
Cisco unveils the Silicon One P200 chip and 8223 routing systems, saying they allow faster data transfers across long optic cables, growing its Broadcom rivalry (Dina Bass/Bloomberg)
China's Cyberspace Administration began a two-month campaign in late September to fight "excessively pessimistic sentiment" and defeatist ideas on social media (Lily Kuo/New York Times)
